intro: Stylopappus elatus, commonly known as the slender pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a slender, erect stem with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Stylopappus elatus is typically found in open, sandy or gravelly habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
